tit.e: Bogo no micchoku (a secret imperial decree)
Bogo no Mitchoku (a secret imperial decree)
Bogo no Mitchoku (a secret imperial decree)

sen.j: 戊午の密勅（ぼごのみっちょく）は1858年9月14日（安政5年8月8日 (旧暦)）に孝明天皇が水戸藩に勅書（勅諚）を下賜した事件である。
sen.e: Bogo no micchoku is an incident that Emperor Komei gave a chokusho (imperial decree) to the Mito Domain on September 14, 1858.
Bogo no mitchoku is an incident that Emperor Komei gave a chokusho (imperial decree) to the Mito Domain on September 14, 1858.
Bogo no mitchoku is an incident that Emperor Komei gave a chokusho (imperial decree) to the Mito Domain on September 14, 1858.

sen.j: 「戊午」は下賜された安政5年の干支が戊午（つちのえ・うま）であったことに由来し、「密勅」とは正式な手続（関白九条尚忠の裁可）を経ないままの下賜であったことによる。
sen.e: "Bogo" is derived from Bogo (also called tsuchinoe, uma), the zodiac sign of that year when the chokusho was given, and "micchoku" or a secret Imperial command means that the document was given without going through the official procedure which required to obtain approbation from Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), Hisatada KUJO.

sen.j: 密勅は万里小路正房より水戸藩京都留守居役鵜飼吉左衛門に下り、吉左衛門の子 鵜飼幸吉の手によって水戸藩家老 安島帯刀を介して水戸藩主徳川慶篤に伝えられた。
sen.e: The micchoku was passed from Naofusa MADENOKOJI to Kichizaemon UGAI, the Kyoto rusuiyaku (a person representing the master during his absence) of the MIto Domain, and Kokichi UGAI, the son of Kichizaemon, passed it to Yoshiatsu TOKUGAWA, the lord of the Mito Domain, via Tatewaki AJIMA, Karo (chief retainer) of the Mito Domain.

sen.j: 幕府には数日後に禁裏付の大久保一翁を通じて伝えられたが、江戸より水戸に先着することを図っての時期であった。
sen.e: Micchoku was conveyed to the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) through Ichio OKUBO, an assistant to Kinri (the Imperial Palace) several days later, but it was such a time-sensitive situations when the micchoku was delivered to Mito earlier than to Edo.

sen.j: 水戸藩以外の徳川御三家、御三卿などには秘匿されていたが、写しは関白以外の摂家を通じて縁家の大名に送付された。
sen.e: The micchoku was kept secret from Tokugawa gosanke and gosankyo (three privileged branches of Tokugawa family) other than the Mito Domain but the copies of it were sent to other related daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) through Sekke (line of regents and advisers) except Kanpaku.

sen.j: 勅許なく日米修好通商条約(安政五カ国条約)に調印したことへの呵責と、詳細な説明の要求。
sen.e: Condemnation against signing the Treaty of Amity and Commerce between the United States and Japan (five-parties treaty in Ansei period) without an imperial sanction and demand a through explanation on it.

sen.j: 御三家および諸藩は幕府に協力して公武合体の実を成し、幕府は攘夷推進の幕政改革を遂行せよとの命令。
sen.e: Order that Tokugawa gosanke and other domains shall realize kobu-gattai, the union of the imperial Court and the Shogunate, in cooperation with the bakufu, and the bakufu shall accelerate to reform the shogunate government to promote the expulsion of foreigners.

sen.j: 幕府の臣下であるはずの水戸藩へ朝廷から直接勅書が渡されたということは幕府が蔑ろにされ威信を失墜させられたということであったため、幕府は勅条の内容を秘匿し、大老井伊直弼による安政の大獄を起こす引き金となった。
sen.e: The fact that the chokusho was delivered directly from the Imperial Court to the Mito Domain that was regarded as a vassal of the bakufu meant that the bakufu was ignored and lost its dignity, so the bakufu kept the contents of the document confidential, which led to trigger the Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate) by Naosuke II, Tairo (chief minister).

sen.j: とりわけ、鵜飼吉左衛門から安島帯刀宛への書簡には井伊直弼暗殺の秘事が記されていたとされ、幕府にその内容が漏洩したことで安政の大獄ではより厳重な処分となったといわれる。
sen.e: Especcially, the letter from Kichizaemon UGAI to Tatewaki AJIMA was said that it contained the secret conspiracy to assassinate Naosuke II, and the leakage of its contents resulted in receiving stricter punishment in the Ansei no Taigoku.

sen.j: もともと、斉昭の藩主就任以来、水戸藩では斉昭に忠実な天狗党と幕府との関係を重視する諸生党の対立が激しかったが、密勅の対応をめぐり、さらに確執を深めることとなった。
sen.e: Originally, since Nariaki TOKUGAWA had assumed the the lord of the domain, Tenguto who were royal to Nariaki had been in fierce conflict with Shoseito who emphasized the relationship with the bakufu, and the feud between them were intencified over how to handle this micchoku.
